website_summaries.verdict: A capable and affordable slicer for homeowners that is best for lighter duty usage.
pros: This lightweight meat slicer weighs just over 12 pounds
The thickness control lets you cut from deli-thin up to half-inch slices
Unit has suction cup feet for stability
cons: The blade doesn't spin as fast as some users would prefer and the machine can be tricky to clean

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! We used this about 3 times. And then it started stinking and smoking!!!! My husband, being the millwright he is, took it apart to find the gear inside is made out of nylon or something and just melted!!!! That was a lot of money! I'm super mad. 😡
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic gear
customer_reviews.text: I've used this slicer for about 2 years. But I used it not many times, probably less than 20 times and it is out of order now. Suddenly it sounded like the gears are out of position and I opened it to fix and see what I discovered inside in the picture. The gear itself is made of weak plastic and has already worn out. It cannot be fixed. Also, it doesn't keep the set thickness. The thickness become thicker and thicker over slices. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chan Lee

customer_reviews.title: Check motor alignment with belt before you turn it on.
customer_reviews.text: Received item was factory flaw motor drive gear is stripped and out of alignment with the belt and slave pulley belt broken before rotated it with motor.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Olson

customer_reviews.title: Never heard back from the seller
customer_reviews.text: Broke down after 4 uses (slicing tender meats, so nothing out of the ordinary). As for support? I tried contacting the seller twice and never heard back. Stay away from this model but most of all away from this seller. First time I have an issue on Amazon but I really wasted my money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Voirin

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean but works great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves smoking brisket, we would have to split the cooked brisket in 1/2 to slice it on our old slicer. This slicer has a very large blade actually love this slicer but it is hard to clean since the only thing that comes apart is the blade. The rest of the machine does not unless someone out there has a secret on how to. I could not find any videos on for this machine. The reason why I deducted 1 star, manufacturers should take this in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: Jerky
customer_reviews.text: We didn't know how this was going to work on raw beef, we had a full side of beef and wanted to process some jerky, it did roll under the blade a bit, but we got the slices we wanted and at the correct thickness.. it did slow down a but but as the beef was raw we had to pull the slices off the back side that were rolling on the blade.. not unexpected. We will use it for slicing deli meats too. A bit hard to clean with all the molded plastic underside of the tray, but as I said not unexpected if we were processing a whole side of beef.
customer_reviews.author: NE Plains Farm

customer_reviews.title: not suitable for slicing cheese
customer_reviews.text: we got this slicer for a variety of small slicing jobs in our restaurant, but did not realize it was not suitable for slicing cheese, or we would not have ordered this item. Also the small part that holds the blade on got lost almost immediately so I had to order another one at $12.98 + shipping for a small plastic disc. It works well for slicing meat.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked and cleaned the food slicer and I was slicing farm fresh bacon within a half hour after unpacking the unit. The blade spins slower than anticipated but once I started slicing I realized it spins fast enough to do the job efficiently and cleanly. I sliced up 16 pounds of bacon in 30 min with breaks in between to bag up batches of meat. The smooth blade is not meant for cheese or bread but I think a serrated blade is readily available from Amazon and can be swapped out in less than a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Diane L Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It’s not pretty but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Price is great however has flaws such as the meat caking up the blade at the bottom. Also notice the angle of the blade to the back as the slices are not even.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: SLICER IS NOT STRONG ENOUGH TO CUT THROUGH A SMALL ...
customer_reviews.text: SLICER IS NOT STRONG ENOUGH TO CUT THROUGH A SMALL BLOCK OF CHEESE. I TRIED TO RETURN ITEM, LABLE & INSTRUCTIONS WERE NEVER SEND TO CORRECT ACCOUNT. ITS NOT THE RIGHT ITEM FOR MY NEEDS. STILL NEW IN BOX ATTEMPTED TO USE ONCE, PROMPTLY CLEANED AND PUT BACK IN BOX.
customer_reviews.author: CourtniMedcalf- Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Very low level slicer, good for veggies and bread.
customer_reviews.text: If you're slicing old bread maybe this would work. If you're slicing 3/4" ham slices, very very very slowly, this may work. If you're trying to use this to do any butchering (slicing home smoked meats for freezing, slicing pieces of loins for steaks). The blade moces/flexes. The backplate flexes, the holder lets everything slip. Pretty poor set up, but you really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K.

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning some parts takes time
customer_reviews.text: Slicing works well. The handle with the nubs on the end need longer nubs so meat doesnt travel off the blade. I would have liked an all metal handle/tray to hold food. The plastic tray has a metal part where the food sets, but it is diffucult to clean as the food gets in the cracks. I had to soak that part and use a nylon brush and flush the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have only used it one time
customer_reviews.text: It is probably over priced since it doesn't work the greatest. It runs way to slow for it to do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B.

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: bought new, but recieved used returned item, with chips in blade, was not repacked correctly, missing parts, not what was advertized
customer_reviews.author: dcl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price, cheap construction...but works
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made but worked well. Blade was worthless out of the box but after some rework got it okay. Did bacon fine and ham at the various slices my family like. Doubt it will last too long but we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Misty D. Abood

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job of slicing cheddar, roast beef, steak. Just difficult to ensure area under blade is clean before you pack it up between uses. It is plastic although silver colored so it is not as heavy as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Win Some Lose Some

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut beef slices for jerky. Works amazing! It only took 10 minutes to cut three giant stacks of beef. Cleanup was extremely easy, and it fits perfectly in my kitchen cupboard!
customer_reviews.author: DMMumey

customer_reviews.title: A sound investment.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for slicing my Jerky meat when the meat has been chilled. Works superbly for slicing cold cuts and cheese
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D Bates

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: bought for the old man for christmas and he uses it nearly daily still. all the time calling us for freshly slices veggies and sandwiches. would get for myself if i had the need
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I have cancer so I need to cook and slice my own meat fresh. This machine works wonderfully. It’s easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It allows the meat to spin with the blade and you could get cut or loose a finger easily. Blade slows down to a crawl as soon ..
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough to cut through a simple loaf of salami. Claims to have adjustable thickness, however, metal backrest is not strudy enough to maintain the thickness causing multiple slices not being what you want. Plastic meat holder does not dig into the meat enough and is dangerous. It allows the meat to spin with the blade and you could get cut or loose a finger easily. Blade slows down to a crawl as soon as the meat hits it.
customer_reviews.author: michael lerner

customer_reviews.title: Don’t settle for less. This is less!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely under powered. A good size it was, but the power of motor was extremely disappointing. The blade was barley held in and just seemed of crappy quality. After I inboxed it, was going to try it out. The. Thought I don’t want to soil it for its return. In my honest opinion. “JUNK” will probably work minimally, but I will pay more for better.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, this is very heavy duty and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my boyfriend, because we are obsessed with beef jerky. I was afraid this would be cheaply made. Fortunately, this is very heavy duty and sturdy. We like our jerky 1/8 inch thick. This slicer did perfectly with the thickness and was easy to clean up. Can't wait to find other uses for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Renea

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.text: Used it one time for about five minutes. Was cutting a ham that was very tender. Stopped working and would not start up again. The instruction manual says not to run for over 15 minutes. Didn’t even get close to that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It is good if you slice very little at a time.
customer_reviews.text: Pladtic gear keeps heat up and damaged. I wish they create a more durable replacement. It is nit fun changing gear every a few use.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly 25

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used it twice on some roast beef. Very slow turning blade . No safety handle. Put it away for a year or so. Forgot about it. Tried cold meatloaf on it this x mas. Blade still too slow. Brought it to my friend is a mechanic. He took it apart and told me the motor was toast. TOTAL garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slicer for home use
customer_reviews.text: I love my slicer works perfect for home use easy to clean the safety guard makes it easy just stay safe very quiet very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Rocky L. Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Dad is very happy
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for my father and he is extremely happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Crystal L. Craft

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 3 stars and unanswered the other question as I gave as gift and guess she like it
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Criswell

customer_reviews.title: Good slicer for home use
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. Wish they had a serrated blade for it as well though. Seems decent for the money, overall glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Miller247

customer_reviews.title: Super Deal
customer_reviews.text: We actually use this in our restaurant and it has held up really well! It's not a pro machine by any means, but we have used it quite a bit and it is still going!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Been used a lot with no problems
customer_reviews.text: I have used this slicer a lot and i am happy with it. I Been using it to slice deer meat and it does a fine job. Only thing is that the meat will slice much better when it is at least half frozen. I wished though it had of came with a blade sharpener. One more thing,.. This slicer cleans up real quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Only

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product for that
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to slice home cured bacon and to make jerky. Not a good product for that. Maybe good for veggies? The motor is loud and the blade doesn't cut meat very well. I sliced around 50lbs of meat over three different uses before the motor burnt up.
customer_reviews.author: PC KS

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love cutting my own meats, wish it had a cheese blade.
customer_reviews.author: Robert White

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. The blade needs a shroud over it the things you are trying to slice stick to the blade wheel and tear what your slicing. Not a good design at all.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Would order again...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well! It’s not commercial, but is great for what we use it for...
customer_reviews.author: Plady

customer_reviews.title: this doesn't cut evenly. and the guide fence moves ...
customer_reviews.text: this doesn't cut evenly. and the guide fence moves too much so it produces uneven cuts. this was my first one though. i'll upgrade in the future.
customer_reviews.author: tim mccool

customer_reviews.title: Not good product
customer_reviews.text: Was very cheap made and does not cut good don’t be tricked
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small meat slicer. My husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Solid slicer
customer_reviews.text: This slicer does a good job slicing the loaves of bread I bake. It is much sturdier than than the previous plastic one we used. We haven't tried it on anything else yet so I can't comment on how it might do on meat or cheese but I do expect to try it on them too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good slicer for the price
customer_reviews.text: The blade speed is slow, and cleaning this thing is a 45 minute job - however it does the job and works well on meat & cheese. A serrated blade would work better on bread. I have used it for nearly 6 hours nonstop and it worked without a hitch. Very quiet also
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut thin slices
customer_reviews.text: I'm use to a professional one. So it's not for me
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Works good for whole hams
customer_reviews.text: Works good for whole hams, briskets, cheeses. Slow blade speed bogs a little on tougher meats but does the job. Only drawback is it throws meat behind blades so you need a table of catch of some sort
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Marginal at best
customer_reviews.text: It is powerful enough but I find it had to get a clean thin slice with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: but it still does a great job for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Its very quite, and does the job I need it to do. If I had one thing to say about it is I wish the blade was covered so the item to be slice will move more smoothly the blade tends to move the item off the machine. but it still does a great job for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: papadom

customer_reviews.title: Good Slicer
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed was the screw lock that holds the blade on only has to turn 1⁄4 to unlock the blade nice, easy to take off and clean. Used it this weekend to slice Ham, Turkey and some block cheese was able to slice everything as thin as paper or as thick as 1/2 inch very strong motor. I purchased this unit to replace my old one (gears broke), because it's belt driven will see over time if it holds up longer.
customer_reviews.author: rfcaddell

customer_reviews.title: More power
customer_reviews.text: Would probably step up a couple models for more power
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I've been cutting cooked roasts and raw venison for jerky and ti is performing well! I wish all meat slicers would design a catch tray on the back and I wish this one was a bit easier to dismantle for cleaning.. performance is great.
customer_reviews.author: gma

customer_reviews.title: ... hard to clean in the crevices but overall a good little machine
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to clean in the crevices but overall a good little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Milam

customer_reviews.title: Value and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Just used for first time. Quiet and slices meat perfectly for jerky.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Good slicer overall.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic shield hits the blade sometimes. Otherwise good slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Williams

customer_reviews.title: Weston 61-0901-W Food Slicer
customer_reviews.text: The slicer was shipped pretty quickly. Unpacked and used the same day. It works great for me. I would recommend that slicer to anyone who is interested in a slicer for use in the home. It is very easy to clean also.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Happy slicing
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. Cuts meat jerky thickness perfect, but found it cuts the meat much easier when semi froze.
customer_reviews.author: coyotebait

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. As a retired chef I can't compare this little gem to the commercial slicers I used for years, but for home it's just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Yankee Fan

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product extensively for slicing cabbage to make sauerkraut, pickles & a little bit for potatoes. Easy to clean, works great, no complaints at all, like it a lot. Can't wait to try it on meat!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Everything that I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It is everything I was looking for. It is heavy duty, and built very well. It is light weight, and easy to clean. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: donald barnett

customer_reviews.title: Terrific slicer!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to slice meats, breads, etc. My wife likes it because it's easy to use and the blade is larger than her old slicer, enabling her to slice larger chunks of meat.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: excellent for size and performance in home
customer_reviews.text: works well! excellent for size and performance in home. Works smooth made well and does not have a serrated slicing wheel nice clean slicing! Besides easy to clean and store away.
customer_reviews.author: Vman

customer_reviews.title: MEAT COLLECTION NOT EASY
customer_reviews.text: Slicer worked great. Sliced meat does not have any collection tray. User must gather sliced meat with free hand. Otherwise, 5 stars to manufacturer. JN
customer_reviews.author: Jody Newman

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money...
customer_reviews.text: The Weston meat slicer is not bad for the money. On the down side, it is a royal pain to clean. In fairness, they probably all are. The only other negative would be that it doesn't cut hard meats (like salami) thin enough to suit us.
customer_reviews.author: SLEEPLESS IN SEATTLE

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: We use it to cut up cheese and lunch meat works perfectly no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Andreana Fordham

customer_reviews.title: Worked good, but I think a serrated blade would work ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked good, but I think a serrated blade would work better trying to cut semifroze meat for jerky.Strips were straight to a certain point then the tapered blade would thin it out. Hope they have a serrated blade.
customer_reviews.author: Brian j corson

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall the love this slicer. The only thing that doesn't wow us is the hand guard. Easy to clean after use. Came quick in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: mikey cheshier

customer_reviews.title: Great Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2012. I think it works great. Its a sharp son of a gun too. Very powerful motor. Easy to clean, but be very careful when removing the blade.
customer_reviews.author: JNGavin

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a xmas gift for my husband and when it was delivered it was not in an amazon box! So now my husband knows what his gift is!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Risley

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: needs a more powerful motor, and a bigger slicing tray for product.
customer_reviews.author: chase griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Best value ever
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Made my money back on this in two uses.
customer_reviews.author: emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Well built but small.
customer_reviews.text: It was too small to slice a full slab of bacon.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Over

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: This slicer is what it is...a hundred dollar slicer. It has a nice look to it but IMO the sliding table that hold the meat is spaced to far away from the blade. This results in uneven cutting and while cutting slab bacon I have to flip the meat over for each cut to keep It even. Other then that it's a strong quiet sturdy machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan6550

customer_reviews.title: good slicer
customer_reviews.text: Nice slicer. A bit slower than others I've used. Raw meat should be mostly frozen, with just a bit of flex to it.
customer_reviews.author: liscubed

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like it is breaking
customer_reviews.text: Will not cut cheese it makes the motor skip the cogs. Sounds like it is breaking. Cutting meat is really a messy job.
customer_reviews.author: rd

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: So far I have not really used this slicer that much. But what times I have used it it preforms flawlessly. Found that everything slices easier and cleaner if it is well chilled first. Doesn't work on freshly cooked meats, but would guess none of the slicers do regardless of price.
customer_reviews.author: Sooperpilot

customer_reviews.title: Great price but not a great machine
customer_reviews.text: Slicer did not perform well at all. Blade did not spin fast enough to cut simple american cheese. the cut was rough and the blade would skip towards the end of the slice. Great price but not a great machine. I sent it back for a better more powerful one.
customer_reviews.author: Santa A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've had this slicer for 10 years and use it almost daily and has never failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: daniel krevdo

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer just wish it could cut thicker then 1/2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great slicer just wish it could cut thicker then 1/2 inch. I would like at least 3/4 to a 1 inch cut option
customer_reviews.author: Brennen Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive model that is perfect for occasional home use
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive model that is perfect for occasional home use. It slices very thin with ease. Only negative comment is cleanup is a bit difficult. It would be better if more of the parts came off the slicer to allow for washing.
customer_reviews.author: James P Hauer

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer!
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for a friend. They said it is much nicer than the one they had and handles the harder chuncks of cheese better.
customer_reviews.author: Wubbaman

customer_reviews.title: Not the power I expexted
customer_reviews.text: Not really a heavy duty, I have been trying to cut some cheese and is not good for that, I was expecting something better, I will have to get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy duty as it looks, the meat ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy duty as it looks, the meat holder on the slide is weak. Should have bought heavier duty slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hockman

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical, but now satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: We used it to cut bacon. Works great! My husband was very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: excellent for the price.I have used it once and it did a great job. Couldn't ask for better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: The Hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of brand worst slicer I ever used. Does not perform. DO NOT buy.
customer_reviews.author: dale w

customer_reviews.title: Did not win my heart
customer_reviews.text: well, I really hoped this would be a champion, but I find the blade to be weak, not very sharp, not able to hustle like I expected. Just a disappointment to me. Sorry, I never like to leave a bad review but this item did not win my heart!
customer_reviews.author: rushtoprep32

customer_reviews.title: Good slicer for home kitchen
customer_reviews.text: The weston meat slicer is a good machine for slicing boneless meat and is very simple to use.The use instruction warns that it should not be used more than 15 min at a time and to stop and let it cool off for 20 or more mins.after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Claude J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not for sliceing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in September 23, 2014 7 months ago. I had surgery in November 20 2014 and did not use it for 3 months. I use it once a week to cut lunch meat. It now will not slice the lunch meat without stopping. This is a toy and should not be used for real meat slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: It did a fantastic job. Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to receive it. We used it immediately on some country ham which we sliced very thin. It did a fantastic job. Easy to use and clean. Very happy with the purchase. For the money you can't do better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for the occasional use. Works well, easy clean up, would recommend. Would like to see a blade sharpener included.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer, we'd love to use it when slicing ...
customer_reviews.text: Great slicer, we'd love to use it when slicing a pork belly smoked on the big green egg for bacon and For slicing ham also smoked.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT R. FINCK

customer_reviews.title: just adequate for the money
customer_reviews.text: this unit is just ok for the money. they need to rethink the food platform on the slide. it way too far from the blade.it is ok for harder cold cuts and cheeses but when it comes to softer meats like roast beef it fails horribly.if the food tray were closer to the blade it would be a magnificent machine but it is not it is just adequate.
customer_reviews.author: william wetmore

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. It sure makes slicing Roast Vegies and cheeses easy. I am impressed with the safty to help advoid cutting fingers. Clean up is fast and easy also. I give it a 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: wgowdy

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job of slicing
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of slicing. It is not as easy to clean as another slicer I used to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless. Don't waste your money! The worst kitchen equipment I ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Zoli

customer_reviews.title: Not very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This slicer is made more for small pieces of meat to cut. Blade slowed down and struggled. Blade also hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: the blade is not sharp, no guard over the slicer blade, never again, dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and I have already had the machine pay for itself by my using it to buy in bulk and make my own "Deli" dishes. I wish that the blade did not dull as quickly as it did, but I am still ahead in the game!
customer_reviews.author: Nick_In_Detroit

customer_reviews.title: seems to do a pretty good job of slicing meats but I noticed the ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only used twice now, seems to do a pretty good job of slicing meats but I noticed the sliding tray is already rusting, one would expect such a product to be made of stainless steel. also the only thing removable is the blade which makes the rest of the machine very hard to clean properly. I would not recommend buying this unit, pay a little more for a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and very handy around the home.
customer_reviews.text: Got this machine about four years ago and it has been indispensable, for meats and vegetables. Wouldn't want to use it in a deli, but super around home.
customer_reviews.author: Baker Daddy - PA

customer_reviews.title: Cuts good, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning requires some work, but that's probably the nature of the machine. Cuts well, but the slice thickness adjuster is limited.
customer_reviews.author: Wrascal Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts deli meat ok but forget cutting cheese totally inefficient and gears grind not finishing the cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well for slicing deer jerky once a year, but not heavy duty enough for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Patton

product_meta.title: Weston 61-0901-W Heavy Duty Meat and Food Slicer, 9", Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: The Weston 9 inch meat slicer features adjustable Thickness settings from deli thin (for shaved cold cuts) to over ½ inch thick (for steaks and chops). the 9" (8 5/8)" Stainless Steel blade is easily removable for cleaning. Suction cup feet for stability. Belt-driven motor. Powerful 150 watt motor (120 Volts, 60 Hz). heavy duty anodized aluminum construction. Tilt-out tray for cleaning. Do not operate the appliance continuously for more than 15 minutes. Be sure to allow the appliance to cool down for 30-60 minutes Before operating again.
feature_bullets: Cut perfectly thin cold cuts and evenly sliced steaks & chops with this durable machine, designed for the home kitchen
Adjustable thickness control for slicing from deli-thin to over ½” thick
Food pusher with teeth for controlled slicing
Sturdy base and suction cup feet for stable and safe operation
Smooth gliding, large capacity, stainless steel food tray tilts out for easy cleaning
Compact design for easy storage and transportation
Crafted from a corrosion resistant coated steel and aluminum housing
150 Watts (120 volts, 60 Hz), CE & UL Approved

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
